Hi, I'm using Cuda 9.0, so the torch version I installed is 1.1.0. It seems that tianshou's requirement is torch>=1.4.0. Is it possible to install tianshou with torch 1.1.0?

comments.comment: Hmm...I have not tested and maybe you can have a try? Run pytest test/ --cov tianshou -s --durations 0 -v and see its behavior. Install pytest: pip3 install pytest
If your Nvidia driver version is greater than 418, you can self-install cuda10 without root (through anaconda).

Emmm... My Nvidia driver version is 384. I set the install_requries in the setup.py to be torch>=1.1.0. Then I do install it. But when I run the python3 test/discrete/test_pg.py. It raises a error: RuntimeError: expected backend CUDA and dtype Double but got backend CUDA and dtype Float
I update the code and now it should not raise the same error. Remove the dependency "torch>=1.4" in setup.py and reinstall tianshou.
